repnme.cdata!:
Hungary - Phaseout of Ozone Depleting
            Substances (GEF) Project

abstracts.cdata!:
Overall the performance of the project
            has been very good. The project is sustainable with both
            World Bank and Borrower performances rated highly
            satisfactory overall. The most important lessons are in the
            areas of project design, the Public Awareness Raising
            Campaign (PARC), and procurement. Some equipment was not
            included in the original sub-projects and had to be procured
            with remaining unallocated funds. Better planning could have
            ensured these were included in their original funding
            requests. The PARC management used a large multi-national
            public relations (PR) company with little interest in the
            environment. Instead the project implementation unit should
            have involved environmental nongovernmental organizations.
            Consultants not committed to true environmental improvements
            are now considered an inappropriate choice for such a
            campaign. In the future, PR firms well experienced in
            environment together with nongovernmental organizations may
            be used as the lead contractors. The Hungarian Refrigeration
            and Air Conditioning Enterprises Association (HRACA)
            complained that Bank procurement procedures did not allow
            them to examine and test goods from different suppliers,
            unaware that this could have been made a condition of prior
            participation in the tender. This suggests that training of
            sub-project enterprises themselves in procurement procedures
            in the start-up phase is needed.

728475.trustfund:
TF026045-ENVIRONMENTAL ACTION PROGRAM
            FOR CEE,TF028306-GEF1-HUNGARY PHASEOUT OF ODS PROJECT

repnme.cdata!:
Hungary - Technical Support and Investment
            Project for the Phaseout of Ozone Depleting Substances

abstracts.cdata!:
The principal objective of the Phaseout
            of Ozone Depleting Substances Project is to assist Hungary
            in the phaseout of ODS consumption in a cost effective
            manner by the year 1996, as mandated by Montreal Protocol
            and its amendments and adjustments. Specifically this
            project will assist Hungary to: 1) support the phaseout of
            the consumption of chlorofluorocarbons (CFCs) through
            adoption of new cost-effective CFC-free technologies; 2)
            phase in the operation of a national network for
            recovery/reclamation/recycling (3R) of refrigerants (CFC-12
            and CFC-11); and 3) through institutional strengthening
            improve the capability of the Ministry for Environment and
            Regional Policy (MERP) to manage and oversee the phaseout of
            ODS in Hungary. The main components of the project are: 1)
            an institutional strengthening component; 2) a recovery,
            reclamation, and recycling component for ODS used as
            refrigerants; and 3) an investment component comprising
            thirteen sub-projects.
